text: Deposed Queen Shin (15 December 1476 – 16 May 1537) (폐비 신씨) was the wife and Queen Consort of King Yeonsangun of Joseon, the 10th monarch of the Joseon Dynasty. ==Family== *Father: Shin Seung-Seon (1436 – 1502) (신승선) **Grandfather: Shin Jeon (신전) **Grandmother: Lady Ahn (안씨) *Mother: Princess Jungmo of the Jeonju Yi clan (중모현주) **Grandfather: Yi Gu, Grand Prince Imyeong (6 January 1420 – 21 January 1469) (이구 임영대군) **Grandmother: Grand Princess Consort Jaean of the Jeonju Choi clan (제안부부인 전주 최씨) *Husband: King Yeonsangun of Joseon (23 November 1476 – 20 November 1506) (조선 연산군) **Son: Unnamed son (1494 – 1494) **Daughter:Princess Hwishin (1495 – ?) (휘신공주) ***Son-in-law: Gu Mun-Gyeong (구문경) **Daughter: Unnamed daughter **Son: Deposed Crown Prince Yi Hwang (10 January 1498 – 24 September 1506) (폐왕세자 이황) **Son: Unnamed son (1500 – ?) **Son: Yi Seong, Grand Prince Changnyeong (1501 – 24 September 1506) (이성 창녕대군) **Son: Unnamed son (1501 – ?) **Son: Unnamed son **Son: Unnamed son (? – 1503) ==Popular culture== * Portrayed by Park Ha-sun in the 2007-2008 SBS TV series The King and I. *Portrayed by Hong Soo-hee in the 2011-2012 JTBC TV series Queen Insoo. *Portrayed by Song Ji In in the 2017 KBS2 TV series Queen for Seven Days. ==References== Category:Joseon Dynasty people Category:15th- century Korean people Category:16th-century Korean people Category:1476 births Category:1537 deaths Category:Royal consorts of the Joseon Dynasty Category:Geochang Shin clan
title: Deposed Queen Sin
